Summary: To measure the market value of the operating assets of firms, relative to operating fundamentals.
Vars: Number of firms in the indusry grouping.
Aggregate enterprise value divided by aggregate earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and R&D, across all firms in group. (Enterprise Value = Market Capitalization + Total Debt - Cash)
Multiple of operating cash flows, with R&D treated as a cap exp, that firms trade at.
Aggregate enterprise value divided by aggregate earnings before interest, taxes and depreciation, across all firms in group. (Enterprise Value = Market Capitalization + Total Debt - Cash)
Multiple of operating cash flows, that firms trade at (treating R&D as an operating expense, the conventional accounting practice).
Aggregate enterprise value divided by aggregate earnings before interest and taxes, across all firms in group. (Enterprise Value = Market Capitalization + Total Debt - Cash)
Multiple of pre-tax operating earnings, that firms trade at.
Aggregate enterprise value divided by aggregate earnings before interest, but after taxes, across all firms in group. (Enterprise Value = Market Capitalization + Total Debt - Cash)
Multiple of after-tax operating earnings, that firms trade at.
table_summary: This table provides financial valuation metrics for various industries. It includes the number of firms in each industry and several valuation ratios such as EV/EBITDAR, EV/EBITDA, EV/EBIT, and their adjusted or alternative values. These metrics are useful for comparing the financial performance and valuation of firms across different industries.
